action.action-desc: Mr. Ryan of New York introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To preempt State restrictions on dispensing mifepristone or misoprostol, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Reproductive Freedom Act.

section.header: Preemption of State restrictions on dispensing mifepristone and misoprostol
section.text: No State may establish, implement, or enforce—

paragraph.text: any prohibition or restriction on shipping or sending mifepristone or misoprostol across State lines;
any requirement that mifepristone or misoprostol be dispensed by a health care practitioner in person; or
any prohibition or restriction on prescribing or dispensing mifepristone or misoprostol by means of telehealth.

section.text: Not later than 30 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Health and Human Services, acting through the Commissioner of Food and Drugs, shall submit a report to the Congress on ways to expand access to abortion medication.

paragraph.text: The term mifepristone means mifepristone that is—

subparagraph.text: approved under subsection (c) or (j) of section 505 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 355);
subject to a risk evaluation and mitigation strategy under section 505–1 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 355–1).

paragraph.text: The term misoprostol means misoprostol that is—

subparagraph.text: approved under subsection (c) or (j) of section 505 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 355);
subject to a risk evaluation and mitigation strategy under section 505–1 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 355–1).
